Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellar_global
Reviews.Content: Location not very good difficult to reach if you do not have taxi direction given by hotel to reach from CIPRO station are not sufficient Rooms very old, need renovation better to look other hotels

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda W
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Quality Nova Domus was certainly the most disappointing part of our trip to Rome. We arrived at the prearranged time and had to wait in the lobby for two hours for our room. Several things in the hotel were not working properly and when we asked were given the response, “It isn’t working today,” including our television (although this was fixed after two complaints), credit card machine, internet, and telephone. The room was tiny, but fairly clean. The bed was extremely firm. The bathroom had the smell of urine emanating from the drain in the floor. The shower had hot water and good pressure, but wasn’t much to look at. There was no air-conditioning so we had to sleep with the window open, which was difficult due to noise in the street. There was also some kind of construction in the hotel beginning at around 8 each morning. Location close to the Vatican and metro, breakfast, and our television being replaced with one that worked were the redeeming factors. It also had a mini-fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, terrible organisation and non functional electricals”
Reviews.Author: Sagrr A
Reviews.Content: Check in was over an hr delayed (3pm) and kept getting postponed. Showers didn't have enough pressure, rooms were tiny/cramped, electrical sockets did not work, neither did the aircon (in addition to really bad ventillation) - this was terrible during warmer nights, charging phones/laptops was a challenge. The cleaning staff/breakfast staff are excellent. Front desk could've adopted MUCH better attitudes, they actually put us on the edge and looked displeased to have hotel guests. One solid bright spot was the location, there's everything around - cafetarias, pizzerias, The Vatican, multiple metros, a Chinese resto! Would never go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to sleep and venture out to the city”
Reviews.Author: Planemeister
Reviews.Content: Very nice place for the price. We liked the room darkening shutters, also shut out any street noise although it is in a quiet area. Nice shower in our room and everything worked. The bed was good. The restaurant was very good for breakfast. The bar prices were too high for a generic hotel bar but service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Sping Break in Italy”
Reviews.Author: ghead02
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nova Domus is a clean and cute hotel with the best breakfast I had in 5 hotels in 10 days.The water pressure was great.and the beds were nice and comfortable.We woke up at 7am with construction noises to a church next door .The hotel was kind to give us a small discount for the inconvenience.You will have to walk at least 15 mins to get to the any attractions.

Reviews.Title: “tthrasher”
Reviews.Author: tthrasher
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant experience here and would stay again. The staff was friendly, courteous & helpful even with the language barriers. They have an impressive breakfast spread incl. scrambled eggs & bacon. The room size was adequate. There was plenty of hot water. Though this is an older building undergoing renovations it is very clean. There is a coffee, sandwich, & pizza shop right across the street. It is within easy walking distance to the metro, fine restaurants. The walking distance to the Vatican from here is probably 7-8 blocks. The travel agency online photos of this hotel did not do it justice. Go to the hotel's website fro better photos.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveler28_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been/is undergoing renovations. I traveled in a group of four and we stayed in a 2 bedroom "suite" in the top floor. I have to say that the construction crew was very respectful and did not work during the times when most visitors are present (i.e. early mornings and after dinner hours). The room was nice and exactly what we needed. This hotel provides breakfast which was good. There are plenty of choices - everyone will find something to eat. The metro is very close (Cipro Stop) and you can be at most of the highly visited locations within 10 minutes. The Vatican is within 10 minutes. However, this is the Vatican museum. Getting to St. Peter's square is an additional 5-10 minute walk. The hotel boasts on its "concierge" services, but overall, I was let down by the helpfulness of the staff in figuring out bus/train schedules. Overall, I would recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “With all the boutique hotels, please don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: jennifer m
Reviews.Content: This was our introduction to Rome. With all the lovely, European hotels, this is a worn out, tired, poorly decorated hotel. The elevator didn't work well, the rooms were worn, and the common areas were something akin to a Social Security office. The location is close to the Vatican - which isn't all that great an area in Rome. There IS a nice market a couple of blocks away that lets you see how the people in Rome shop. No good restaurants close, really. But a pretty good gellato place across the street a little. The breakfast was really pretty good. This was probably our worst stay on our Italy excursion. It wasn't dirty, just no atmosphere what so ever.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement!”
Reviews.Author: JanetLeverton
Reviews.Content: A great location for a city break, walking distance to the Vatican and many other sites. The room was clean and quiet, with plenty of hot water. However, there were many things not fuctioning properly, the tv, the curtains, the wifi etc. Despite arriving during the coldest spell in Rome for 25 years the heating wasn't on in our room when we arrived and the blankets that we got out of the cupboard for the bed were returned there each day! The restaurant and bar were not open at all, the only food available at the hotel was breakfast. I think there is probably better available in Rome for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice for the Eternal City visit”
Reviews.Author: Rasha971
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nova Domus is very useful city hotel. It is located near Vatican, near metro line in quiet city quarters. It provides very good value for money. The rooms are clean, the buffet breakfast was excellent and stuff was very helpful. I could recommend this hotel for the Rome visit and also stay there again for some visit in future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: cardinal73
Reviews.Content: It is very nice hotel in quit neighborhood nearby Vatican City. Cipro metro station is located in a 5 minutes walk from the hotel which provides a good accessibility to all mayor attractions in Rome. Rooms are big enough, clean with not large but functional bathroom. Breakfast was tasteful with the best hotel coffee ever. The receptionists and other stuff were helpful, pleasant and discrete. In conclusion, this hotel could be our choice for some next visit to this magnificent city.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly reception but facilities let it down.”
Reviews.Author: Cleverclares
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed here for 4 nights between Christmas and new year. The staff on reception were friendly and helpfully the majority of the time, unlike the restaurant manager who could do with a refresher course at charm school! The first room we had was next to the lift which was very noisy, keeping us awake half the night. The receptionist changed us to an upgraded room as soon as we complained with no fuss at all. The second room was quieter but rather worn with stains on the carpet, half the tv channels didn't work, and the safe was faulty. We reported this but it wasn't fixed. The carpet could also have been hoovered more thoroughly. Also, the mini bar wasn't stocked with anything, but this suited us as it meant we could fill it with our own drinks etc. The shower room was nice with marble tiles / sink and the shower had plenty of power. There was also a bidet. The hotel was advertised as having a restaurant and bar. The bar was closed for the duration of our stay, and the restaurant was only open for breakfast. The breakfast was quite limited, the hot drinks were particularly poor as they came from a vending machine using powdered milk. The hotel is in a good location for the Vatican and close to two metro stations so you can be in the centre of Rome in half an hour. There is also a good range of restaurants on the nearby streets to choose from. If you choose to get a taxi from the train terminus it should only cost around €15. We were overcharged on arrival and paid €38 so be ready to negotiate with the driver.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful people but hotel needs help”
Reviews.Author: mizzou37
Reviews.Content: The hotel in and of itself is fine. Clean, fairly good location (1/2 mile to Vatican) and has great FREE breakfast. Staff are wonderful but the hotel has some serious shortcomings. You cannot get a cup of coffee until 7 a.m. That's what time the restaurant opens and they are inflexible about opening up early. There is no place around to get a coffee prior to that because we checked. We stayed in two different rooms because we left and took a two-day trip to Venice. The phone didn't work in the first room, the TV was not working very well and the walls are thin. You can hear your neighbours. The second room had no electrical plug in the bathroom - just wires coming out of the wall :-( The boiler had blown and we had no hot water for two days. The rooms are perfectly adequate in size, not like USA, but okay. The staff was terrific and very helpful regarding everything. The location isn't great but not bad. We ate at three different restaurants within the neighbourhood which all were good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rome”
Reviews.Author: holidayholicm
Reviews.Content: I would travel to Rome Solo- this is a beautiful hotel close to the metro. Not a choice of hotel I would have expected Travel Sphere/ Page & Moy to chose, especially as upon arrival the group of 25+ travellers were made to walk half a mile up the road with their luggage to get to the hotel when the bus driver could have dropped us at the top end of the hotel. Comfortable rooms, food not to return for at this hotel- enough places in the vicinity to eat rather than be served overcooked food. Again Travel Sphere rep could have done more but he was not too bothered. All the paid excursions were amazing as were the local tour reps- something of a lesson for a corporate like Travel Sphere to reflect on as I will certainly not return to book a holiday with them.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely come back :) Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: laura c
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel was awesome... We stayed for 5 days and we have to say that the staff in this place is very proffesional. At the reception - very very kind...if we needed something - they always tried to pleased us. The room not so big, but very clean. The breakfast was good. We will certainly go back. The rate was very good . Rome it's such a nice place!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “2 out of 3 escape ways obstructed”
Reviews.Author: lovelyrome_11
Reviews.Content: - Escape ways lead through 2 staircases down to the 1st floor, from the first floor 3 signed escape ways lead to a balcony, from there down to the street. At the 1st floor the middle escape way to the balcony was completely obstructed by tables, chairs etc and not to be used. In the second escape way (staircase) tables, paper, bottles and trolleys of the restaurant were stored so only a small path to the escape door was left. The reception was informed twice, from arrival in the afternoon till departure after the second night nothing had changed at all. - hot shower did not work - hotel management does not seem actually interested - otherwise hotel would be ok, calm street, nice balcony for breakfast, 10 min to the next metro station,

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: -Travel-Nut-86-
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed here two years ago on my prior trip to rome. Great location, walking distance to the metro and the vatican. There are dozens of cafes, pastery shops, etc within walking distance. Totally reasonable room rates...yes the rooms aren't huge, but that's how europe is...and really who goes to rome to stay in the room. I loaded up on breakfast every morning here (and espresso!) Which kept me fueled for the day of sight-seeing and saved me some money. Rooms were clean, service was friendly, bartender was amazing...i definitely hope to come back here next time! My last trip to rome I stayed at a hostel, big mistake, I didn't save much and it would have been way worth the extra cost to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “OK Rooms, Great Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: laurenf2012
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a decent hotel for the money. The location was a little difficult to find if walking from the metro stop because the sign is hidden. If walking from the metro the first time you arrive make sure to carry a map with you. The rooms were ok but a little worn and small for four people. The bathroom and shower were great except there was no light in the shower so we had to shower in the dark. The location is great when exploring the Vatican, just a 12 minute walk! There is an inside food market just two blocks from the Hotel that was great for picking up fresh produce and breads to picnic, we did that for a few meals and was able to save some money. The staff was a mixture of curt and wonderful. We had a visitor come to the hotel one day and the reception was rude and was hesitant to even allow our friend to call our room or come upstairs. They were not welcoming or helpful at that time. Later in the day however, the evening desk attendants were wonderfully helpful in telling us how to go about getting train tickets, calling us cabs, leaving mail, and answered all of our many questions with a smile. The breakfast was one of the best parts of the stay. Eggs, bacon, rolls, cereal, fruit, yogurt,coffee, and juice was wonderful!! It was a nice break from breakfasts that only served pastries and old coffee! They had a terrace that you could sit on to eat which was wonderful. I would suggest this hotel again if you are planning to spend most of your time exploring the city around the Vatican and not planning to spend much time in the rooms. Take advantage of the great breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Flat bed, warm shower, filling breakfast=Happy American woman :)”
Reviews.Author: vegasscot
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights with my Mother-in-law while we were touring Europe. After all the reviews I had read about hotels in my price range in Rome, I was pleasantly surprised to find that the Hotel Nova Domus was just perfect for my needs! As an American, I've stayed in my fair share of ultra-luxury hotel rooms. This hotel is not one of those places. It's homey, you actually have to speak to the front desk to retrieve your key when you return to the hotel. Also, the entire staff spoke perfect English. There is a perfectly good elevator to whisk you up to your room with your suitcase. The room is small, (I got the 2-twin version) and the TV is adorable (tiny). The marble bathroom was gorgeous. The beds were good and the water was hot and plentiful. Breakfast in the dining room was great, but not as good as roaming the back streets of that neighborhood for the little cafes that are in every little nook. I was a bit of a hike for my MIL to the subway, (about 6 blocks), and since the Vatican Museum was closed we had to hike further to get inside Vatican City. All in all, a safe, warm place to sleep and shower between excursions. I would stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “As expected for that price”
Reviews.Author: Silje_NO
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the room was a bit worn. TV was out of order and it was impossible to set the AC temperature. OK breakfast. About a 15 minute walk from the Vatican Museum. The price was low, so all in all is good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise Hotel............Close to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: professionalcritic00
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews after we booked for the hotel and were very apprehensive if it was a right hotel. However we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the hotel and may be it is because we were lucky to get one of the better rooms. (cos we heard a couple complaining that the AC was not working in their room). Our aircon was working and the room was clean and so the toilet. The breakfast was OK and not lavish as others mention. We were having our breakfast by 9am so I guess we had small choice left by the time we reached. We stayed 5 nights at the hotel so the breakfast became boring as it was the same things served everyday. The location of the hotel is very close to the Vatican and also to the metro, so you have most of the tourist spots within 5-10 min walk/metro. You have excellent restuarants near Nova Domus with CIRO & CIRO been the highlight. It is just 2mins away from the hotel and we really enjoyed the freshly made pasta and pizza here. You also have a Chinese&Japanese Hotel Wok next to the hotel which has a good choice of oriental food. Right across the road there is also an Ice-cream shop which was just yummy. You must eat and enjoy lots of icecream when in Italy. Overall we had a pleasant stay in Rome at Nova Domus

Reviews.Title: “It worths”
Reviews.Author: CZB3
Reviews.Content: A good and confortable hotel. The room was quite big and spacious. It was very clean, everyday someone came and vacuumed the room, changed the bed linen, replace every used object. The TV had just 4 or 5 channelswich isn't a big tragedy for a tourist in Rome but more channels would be welcome. The bathrooms was large enough but the only inconvenient was that they have a bathtub with a curtain insted to have a shower. The staff was kind not very talkative. Good food for the breakfast, various dishes for every taste. The hotel has also a restaurant were you could eat whenever you want cheaper than in other restaurants ( 15 euros / meniu). The hotel in well situated form just 10 min. walking to Vatican and 5 minutes to the subway station Cipro where you could reach any destination in Rome. ADVICE: If you want to visit Vatican (SIstine chapel, Vatican Museu, St.Peter's basilica) you'd better buy online tickets in order to avoid the huge queue wich can lasts hours.

Reviews.Title: “Really Bad Choice of Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Lori S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1-night at the beginning of a Collette Explorations tour of Tuscany and Umbria. This was such a bad choice of hotels: location, customer service, rooms!! I can't believe that a tour company wants their guests to start out in this dump. In fact, I renamed the hotel Nova Dump-Us. As soon as I saw my room, I wanted to go and spend my own money to stay in a nicer hotel. My room had 2-small twin beds, an airconditioner that was not turned on until June, many different colors of beige on the walls in an attempt (I guess) to cover all the skuff marks, and dents in the wall. I really felt like I was staying in a "flea bag" hotel! I came down right away to ask for another room, and the young lady at the front desk said the hotel was full, in addition to having an attitude. Fortunately the tour guide offered me another option, and when I went to see it there was only a skylight, and the room looked like a attic, so I kept the original room. I really would have left and stayed somewhere else if I was not traveling with a friend. She convinced me to stay, and reminded me that we would only be sleeping there 1-night, then moving on to what we were hoping would be a much nicer hotel. (Fortunately it was!!) I considered sleeping full-clothed, but when I removed the nasty bedspreads and moved the beds together it seemed a LITTLE better. I had to keep the window open all night, and it was still dreadfully hot. Fortunately my phone has a "sound machine" app, but that still was not enough to cover up the street sounds. The breakfast in the morning was not much better, but at least there was something to eat. I really hope Collette Vacations decides to choose another hotel for their tours out of Rome. This hotel is about a mile from the Vatican in the middle of a residential area. The sites of central Rome are not within walking distance, and this might be OK if the hotel was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast and near Vatican”
Reviews.Author: basingstoke22
Reviews.Content: Receptionist on arrival was very rude on asking for our passport why they need it,the rest of the staff are helpful,breakfast was good and the location of the hotel was accessible to restaurants and shops.The hotel itself needs updating,uncomfortable beds and poor air conditioning.Staff needs further training on customer service specially the receptionist as they were the first person welcoming you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but only a 3-star at best”
Reviews.Author: beavertrail
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night as this was the starting point of a tour. The hotel is in a very good location - walking distance to the Vatican. The room we stayed in was fine though it was past it's prime and needed refreshing/remodelling. I don't see how this hotel rates 4-stars as I felt it was a 3-star hotel at best, especially in a city like Rome with some great hotels. The bathroom was fine but again it needed to be redone. The bed was firm but comfortable and the noise level was low which made for a good nights sleep. The hotel does serve an excellent breakfast with good variety of meats, cheeses, breads, juices and even eggs and bacon. The staff seemed friendly enough but hard to judge since I only spent one night at the hotel and did not interact with them that much.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ton_amie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days just before Easter. We really enjoyed the comfort, spaciousness, and cleanliness of this hotel, In addition, this hotel is quiet and restful. It is within easy walking distance to the Vatican. That was perfect for us as we had planned to spend quite a bit of time in that area. Breakfast provided lots of variety: eggs, breads, ham, juices, and fruit. This is a wonderful hotel. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Dcent hotel at resonable price.”
Reviews.Author: GarthDanlor
Reviews.Content: While not right in the heart of the action, the Nova Domus is situated within easy walking distance of the Metro, restaurants, pubs and a grocery store. It is also only a short walk away from the Vatican. The rooms were of adequate size and in adequate condition. The breakfast was above average when compared to other hotel breakfasts we have had in Europe. All in all, a very good deal for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Could use some spiffing up.”
Reviews.Author: Italychaperone
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not terrible, but when we arrived, the exterior looked tired and depressing. Our first room, the walls were in disrepair and the bedding, linens, etc. really seemed ready for some updated (they seemed very tired looking). Our room was changed and it was not much better, but the wall weren't falling apart. The staff was polite and helpful. There is a little bar that is pleasant, but not much other space to relax in other than your room. The breakfast was adequate and most people could certainly find something to eat. The location is fine for the Vatican, but is not that convenient for other Rome sights. I think that if a little bit of effort were put in to painting the rooms, replacing worn carpets, bedding, drapes, etc., the place would be just fine for the kind of hotel that it is.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value for money, an ideal location for the Vatican City”
Reviews.Author: meganhill95
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at this hotel. Our trip was to watch the Italy v Wales rugby international and to include as much sightseeing as we could fit in. We arrived at the hotel after a long day travelling and were met with very helpful and polite staff. We were given a family size room which was great. It was spotlessly clean with a fabulous bathroom including a high pressure shower and jacuuzi bath. The breakfast in the hotel was fabulous , it included the usual continental style croissants, ham , cheese etc but also bacon and scrambled eggs. The location of the hotel is excellent, not the most attractive looking of neighbourhoods but only a fiften minute walk to the St.Peter's Basilica, Vatican City etc. The first evening we ate at a chinese restaurnat right oppsite the hotel as we were to tired to explore. Fantastic food,and very reasonable. Also there's a lovely restaurant a couple of blocks away owned by an ex Italian rugby player. It serves traditional roman style food over five courses at a cost of just 25 euros and the house wine is only 8 euros per caraffe(The restaurant is on a road called via bittolo and it's called Angelo.) The nearest metro station is the Ciprio stop which leads to all attractions in a short journey. All in all a great place to stay and having paid a total of £145 through Last minute.com we felt we had excellent value for money. Mike and Lorna x

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality, Friendly Staff, Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: rbmtl722
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel speaks reasonable English, and were more than available to teach me a few basic Italian words/sentences. To expect fluent English speaking staff is arrogant. I was lucky to get a 5th floor room with a balcony with a great view of St Peter's dome. The hotel is located well within walking distance of the Cipro Metropolitana Linea A stop I tried 2 restaurants near by, the chinese/japanese restaurant across the street and the pizzeria across the street when you make a right as you exit the hotel. Both were great vaues and the food was above par! I would definitely recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there on my next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Basically pay for location!”
Reviews.Author: ZoePR
Reviews.Content: If you look for a close to Vatican and Metro, affordable Hotel this is a good option. Gives a bed and clean bathroom. Breakfast is not the best, so if you have to pay extra I would recomend elsewhere. They also charge a "TOURIST FEE" 3 euros a night p/p and do not mention it until checkout. Have fun on the close restaurants and walks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic breakfast! Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly_in_ChiTown
Reviews.Content: We were 3 girls travelling around Italy independently, with our rental car, and none of us speaking Italian. This is the ONLY hotel we had booked where they speak English. And what a GODSEND! I can't even tell you what a relief it was. The friendly, helpful staff were lifesavers. I left my luggage at the previous hotel and it took 4 days of phone calls from the Hotel Nova Domus front desk staff to my previous hotel to get my luggage back. Also many faxes had to be exchanged. It was a nightmare. Despite many daily phone calls back and forth, the staff at Hotel Nova Domus were utterly polite and calm and never seemed to be bothered by all the hassle I was putting them through to get my stupid luggage back. YOU GUYS ROCK!! Breakfast buffet was THE BEST we had in Italy on our 14 days there. Good old American style buffet: Omelets! Hard boiled eggs! Bacon! Plus every kind of toast, fruit, yogurt, cereal that you can think of. Most hotels in Italy serve "Italian style" breakfast which means: cakes and cold cuts and yogurt. It was sooooooo wonderful to taste an American style breakfast again, just to taste EGGS again! You can't even imagine. TV in room had an actual ENGLISH speaking channel! I think it was BBC or CNN which was fantastic as most Italian hotels never have english tv. Everyone staying here is with some kind of english speaking Tour Bus trip so you feel right away that you are almost back on "friendly American soil"...just hearing your own language is refreshing after 10 days without it. :) Room is very tight but we expected that for the price. Bathtub was VERY old as was whole bathroom (but also that's normal for Italy too). Nobody believed this was 4 star hotel as its got a tattered canopy out front and is across from a chinese restaurant in a dangerous looking neighborhood. But the customer service and breakfast made up for it! Location really sucked as there is nothing to walk to or do nearby within about 6 blocks. However, with a cab you can be at Vatican in 10 minutes or so. If you have car or scooter, it's perfect location - free gated parking at hotel. Gelateria across street was pretty bland but if you don't care much about gelatto, it's probably ok. I recommend the Dark Chocolate combined with the Pear Ricotta Cheese...mmm!! The pizzeria across street and to the right is AWESOME!! The best pizza we had our whole trip across Italy was served there. It's an "all locals" kind of place but you can point at something on menu and they will bring so no Italiano necessary. Wonderful FRIENDLY staff there! Overall, 2 thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “disrespectful staff”
Reviews.Author: 155041James
Reviews.Content: Im very happy to say that this Hotel is now taken of Expedia.com and many other sites that recommend this hotel. We had phoned the hotel to hold on to our reservation because we were late because of our flight she said no problem. when we arrived the lady that was working at the front desk (which was the one on the phone) said that she cancelled our reservation. when we told her that she said she would hold it, she denied that. she starting freaking out, swearing, after we said that we would stay till we get a room. the manager did nothing at all with the cituation. Thanks to mrs. cranky for ruining our vacation. and we and my travel agent will do everything we can to block this hotel and so far its working.

Reviews.Title: “Big, comfortable rooms; great location; even better price!”
Reviews.Author: AdvisorKing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quality Hotel Nova Domus for three nights. We are a family of four and were travelling through Europe for a month this summer. This stop occurred more-or-less in the middle of our trip. The Nova Domus was probably the nicest hotel we stayed in on our trip and if I went back to Rome, I might not bother looking around before booking here again. We paid $95 per night (via Expedia) each for two adjacent rooms. The rooms were large, with big, comfortable beds. The furniture and fixtures were all very modern. The rooms were largely indistinguishable from what I would expect from a business-class hotel in North America. The lobby was large and welcoming with very efficient check-in. In particular, the desk clerk was very helpful in providing a map and identifying points of interest for us. The hotel was larger than I had expected, with wide hallways and about 20 rooms on each of its five floors. The hotel is within a 10-minute or so walk from both the Vatican and the nearest metro/subway station. Once I knew where to look, I could actually see the top of the dome of St. Peter’s from my window (although I had to be practically standing on the window sill, but I could see it!). There are a couple restaurants and an ice cream shop nearby, but it is not the least bit noisy. The breakfast buffet (which is included in the room rate) was one of the best I’ve had. It contained a variety of hot items (e.g., scrambled eggs and bacon), fruits, cereals and various other items. It also stayed open late, which is valuable to us because we tend to stay up late and sleep-in when we’re on vacation. Having stayed at some marginal properties during the first half of our European vacation, we were very happy to settle in at the Quality Hotel Nova Domus for our stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Helpful”
Reviews.Author: markforbes
Reviews.Content: We struggled looking for a hotel in Rome for our budget of upto 200 euro per night for a family of 3, there was a lot of choice and we just couldnt decide... Then I stumbled on an ebay auction of all things featuring this hotel at a fixed price for 2 nights with a few extras thrown in including dinner one night and a bottle of asti. There was also stated an option to upgrade to a junior suite for an extra 90 euro per night.. Before bidding we asked seller a question and got a very prompt reply to confirm the dates we wanted were available so we bought the auction and were quickly confirmed. On arrival we were met by a real welcoming and friendly reception guy who explained everything to us and spent time goiing through things to do and see, asking which night we would like to eat and when we would like our wine. We were given our keys and found our room which was comfortable and gave seperation between us and teenage daughter. There was also a balcony overlooking what appeared to be a school yard. The bathroom was well laid out and the shower nice and powerfull, the ac worked fine and the flat screen tv had a decent selection of channels The asti was deleivered nicely chilled and promptly to our room and we settled in. We went down for dinner at 7.30 and whilst the choice was extremely limited for voucher holders the service was very friendly and the food we had was enjoyable. The head waiter was also very friendly and the voucher even included a small bottle fo wine and mineral water. Breakfast service is also very efficient and has a good selection of pastries juices anbd cold cuts (again included) The location is great for the vatican museums but maybe not so good for other sights although the nearest metro station is cipro only about a 10 minute walk. Of the 4 places we stayed on our italian tour this was our second favourite, considering 2 of the others feature in TA top 10's that makes it good for us though having read some other reviews it may have been a wise move going for the junior suite!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: yebhsa
Reviews.Content: This was a super spot to stay. It was close to the Metro as well as very close to the Vatican. Breakfast was also very good, but get there early. It starts at 7:00, and there are a lot of people there then. We had a little trouble with our bed, but they were apparently able to fix it as the problem hasn't occurred again. If driving to Rome, make sure to pick up a good map. However, free parking here is great.

Reviews.Title: “Not super, just okay!”
Reviews.Author: jamaicajim
Reviews.Content: I am somewhat disappointed in the Nova Dpmus Hotel. Other travelers have both extolled and panned the included breakfast buffet. I found it had a large selection but was short in substance ... same old same old every morning. The rooms are small ... about twelve by twelve. The bathroom is small ... ours had a shower only. Beds gave a whole new meaning to "firm" mattresses! I was looking forward to keeping in touch with my netbook. Wi-fi internet access is pricey ... started at 5 euros for one hour, then 10 euros for a day, and 12 euros for two days. However, the rates weren't told to me at the beginning. Internet service dropped out more than once, requiring a new code to log-on. Would I stay here again? Probably not. Jim

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and beautiful area”
Reviews.Author: carmence33
Reviews.Content: WELL LOCATED, NICE STAFF, GREAT AREA, very close to St Peter Cathedral and close to metro station. Quiet and nice

Reviews.Title: “Room is small and old. Dirty carpet. Room...”
Reviews.Author: si_jangkung
Reviews.Content: Room is small and old. Dirty carpet. Room smelled like some parfumy.. Like those powder you put on the carpet before vacuming. Lots of mold on the shower wall. Bathroom so small you can hardly move. Avoid this hotel. You'll find better hotel for the same price at better location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rahulge1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nova Domus for 4 nights just before the Easter weekend (April 2010). The staff is friendly, check-in was smooth and the hotel lobby has been renovated. The location is good - just a 10 - 15 min walk from the Vatican Museum and the St. Peter Cathedral. The main city is not too far either. You have the tourist buses that start from around the Vatican area (Cristiano Roma, Red Bus etc). There are enough restaurants and shops close to this hotel. The only negatives are the rooms are slightly small and the walls could be slightly dirty in some rooms. The television sets are from the 1980's (12-14 inch tv's!). Overall: Recommended for the price! (Paid 120 Euros per night including breakfast). The breakfast is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “good four star hotel in rome near the vatican museum”
Reviews.Author: romolo2009
Reviews.Content: we made a reservation in this good four star hotel in Rome thanks to the good reviews we finded on tripadvisor. the hotel is good located at just five minutes walking distance from the Vatican Museum and the Vatican City. we (me, my wife and our 2 children ) had a family room on the second floor. this kind of accommodation is the best we could find for 4 persons. the staff is very professional, they gave us good suggestion for city trip. the restaurant on the first floor , with his terrace is perfect for us to have lunch and dinner. the breakfast room

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ABVVarna
Reviews.Content: I would like to support the positive reviews of Nova Domus hotel. It has great location - situated on a quiet street, very close to the entrance of the Vatican Museum, near to metro station and bus stop(buy a day-ticket for 4 EUR and use bus 492 to reach every important sights in the center of Rome easily); two blocks from the local market, lots of shops and restaurants around. Hotel has free secured parking, which is a great advantage compared to most of the hotels in Rome. Rooms are nice, comfortable and clean enough (at least 103 and 106), but definitely not 4 stars; good air condition system; only negative thing - blankets just wrapped up in sheets. Excellent buffet breakfast included in price - good variety of food, breakfast rooms are big enough and you don't have to wait for a table. Staff was polite and helpful. I would definitely stay at Nova Domus again and I would recommend it to everyone who is looking for a nice place on acceptable price to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price, But paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Roamingtheworld12
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Hotel Nova Domus, they are remodeling the entrance but didn't make for much of a hassle. Good location, 10-15 min walk to vatican, and same for Cipro metro. (Metro is 4 euro's for the day which is unlimited travel, very good way of getting around). The rooms are nice, need a lick of paint, bit tatty in places. But overall not bad. Ive read some comments about funny smells which is true, just old carpets I think. Breakfast was good, lots of fruit, bread, cereals, bacon, eggs ect. (try the creme caramels, very tasty!) So all in all its an ok hotel, which is reflected in the price. The only bad thing, the walls are paper thin. We had a guy spend the night on his phone, kept us up until 2am, we asked to change room's but where told there was no other rooms available. We did politely end up knocking on the door and asking him to keep it down. But you can hear everything in the next room, if you know what I mean! Staff where very polite and friendly though. Very good service

Reviews.Title: “Good location not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: outdoorfunwashington
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Nova Domus from 12/31 - 1/5/2010 a 15 minute walk to the vatican. Our room was very warm, smelled and the entrance was being remodeled so the entrance to the hotel was the theatre entrance. The buffet breakfast was very good. I would give this a 3 star at best. Staff was not very helpful almost with the "Who cares" attitude since Trafalgar probably books this hotel up and the staff do not care. This hotel is in a residential area and close to the metro. Previous review said it was 2 blocks to the Vatican...it is not! S. Johnson

Reviews.Title: “short stay trip couple”
Reviews.Author: evs40
Reviews.Content: the hotel was in an exccellent location and the staff were pleasant & polite. on arrival we were shown to our room only to find a dirty sock from the previous occupants & cigarette burns on the bed linen, we asked to change rooms and we were moved straight away. the rooms are basic and small also could do with moderisation. we requested a non smoking room but there was a distinct smell of stale tobbaco. the breakfast was fairly decent with a fair choice, the bar area was very small this hotel was graded as a four star but would only be two star in uk. there was some improvement work taken place during our stay but for us to return it would need a major refurb

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: jameshome7
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located a 10 minute walk from Cipro Metro station, which in turn is approx a 30 minute Metro ride from Termini. (Take the first flight of stairs out of Cipro, turn right and head past the fountain. The Hotel was welcoming, not quite 4 star, but would say a mid-range 3 star. Rooms were clean only negative. the carpets stained, but otherwise perfectly acceptable accommodation for a City break. No tea/coffee making facilities - would recommend stocking fridge up with juices etc. There is a supermarket located directly opposite Cipro Metro. Use the underpass to cross, carry on straight and look for a downwards ramp on your right. Breakfast was good with choice of scrambled eggs, bacon and the usual Continental selection of cereals, cheese, ham and pastries. Located in a residential area, not a great area for eating out.. The Restaurant in the Hotel was expensive and along with the bar, not very attractive. You can easily walk to the Vatican - about 20 minutes - and there are plenty of Restaurants etc there.

Reviews.Title: “NOVA DOMUS - FANTASTIC LOCATION, FABULOUS ROOM, TERRIFIC FOOD AND SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: PPadolsky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Nova Domus Hotel for 4 days prior to our cruise on Carnival's new Dream to the Grand Mediterranean. THIS is THE HOTEL to stay at. It has great charm, is 2 blocks from the Vatican, it's in a wonderfully posh and safe area of Rome, is near great restaurants, attractions, subway and trolley, and has fantastic food. The staff could not have been nicer. The rooms (we had a suite) were VERY spacious with a jacuzzi, huge bathroom (all marble tile), living room, bedroom (with flat screen), balcony (all for the price of a regular room at another hotel), and loads of space for almost 3 weeks worth of clothing that we had! The buffet breakfasts (indoors or outdoors on their 2nd floor within a beautiful garden) were amazing with everything you would want, and more. The location was really convenient to everything, and the neighborhood was like SOHO in NYC - a beautiful residential area with lovely outdoor restaurants and stores within close walking distance. It even has a sports bar and lounge with beautiful leather seating! Don't look anywhere else unless you want a really small room with small beds and no space. Rome hotels are like that unless you pay a fortune for a 5-star hotel. This was a 4-star, but better than many 5-stars that we saw. Ciao! And have a fantastic time!!! (We loved every minute of it!!!)

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: lovePR57
Reviews.Content: O.K. First of all I am reading some of the negative comments that some people are leaving on this hotel. It seems that these people were expecting to stay at the Plaza Hotel. I guess the hotel I stayed in must not be the same that they are describing. I really liked this hotel; It was very clean and updated. The towels were extra large and plush. It had a jacuzzi tub. The beds were a little hard but still comfortable. The hotel have shudders on the window its suppose to make the room extra dark for siesta its what the Italians do after 12:00 they nap; I hate to be sarcastic but it seem some people go to other counties expecting for it to be exactly like it is in there home. If you expect that then just stay home. These shudders could be lifted to let in light in the room. The breakfast is included in the price of the hotel. It was a good basic breakfast it offered a good variety. If you want to be close to the Trevi fountain and Colosseum I suggest to stay at another hotel; it is quite far. You could take a cab or the metro which is only about a 10 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the money”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo54
Reviews.Content: Located in a great area if you want to be away from all the touristy area and really see how Rome is in a regular neighborhood. The breakfast is a free buffet with coffee/tea etc, juices, yogurts, cereals, fruits, eggs, meats, lots of cornettos and other pastries, cheeses, etc. For a free buffet; pretty good value. Staff is professional. The internet was not working, but it did not matter to me because it was way to expensive, about 24 Euros for 1 day, you can get a voucher from the hotel for a cheaper rate, but it is not that much cheaper. The subway is about 10 minutes walk. The area is totally safe during the day and at night. Safe and clean like most hotels in Europe. My favorite thing: it is located about 2 blocks from a local market, cannot beat that! I bought this hotel from Hotwire, and it was sold as a 3.5 stars. The hotel is not what in the US would be a 3.5 hotel, but in European rating I think it fits.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: SingleSingapore
Reviews.Content: We had a comfortable stay for 6 nights. The room is sufficient clean, enough space for 2 pax. The breakfast is bare minimum as compare to Asian hotels. Only the scrambled eggs and bacon are warm. The rest of the items like hard boiled eggs, tomatoes, breads, ham etc are all served cold. No fresh fruits except canned ones like peaches, mixed fruits. The coffee machine served decent coffee, hot chocolate etc. 1 machine for the whole breakfast room. The wireless internet is expensive at 5 euros an hour and we need to purchase it at the front office before utilising it in the room. We end up at an internet joint although not many in Rome city. The hotel is less than 10 minutes walk to "Cirpo" subway. It is safe to walk in the night after 9pm as it is located in a decent and quiet residential area. There are not many restaurants in the area except WOK Restaurant across from the hotel which served Japanese and Chinese food. Coming from Singapore, the food is decent in taste as compare to other Asian restaurants in other European cities. The price for a plate of fried rice with chicken slices is below 4 euros. The gelatore across the main street from the hotel is superb. We had it every day. The smallest cup is only 2 euros and could choose up to 2 flavours. There is a decent well stocked supermarket (also called supermercato) along the way about 3 minutes walk from the subway facing the fountain/children playground (tuck in a corner). Vatican is within walking distance about 15 minutes. Convenient to move around to major sites. As a whole, we would stay in this hotel again given the location and price we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, elegant and worht it”
Reviews.Author: DLaytoun
Reviews.Content: The staff were extermely helpful and friendly, the rooms were beautiful, cool and comfortable. The location is right by the Vatican(easily walkable) and close to the metro for everything else. Breakfast was fantastic, a great selection, and the surrounding area is nice. Air con works quietly if not slightly confusingly. Fantastic stay here, definitly recommended, although not very much to look at from the outside.

Reviews.Title: “four star hotel in rome italy near the vatican city good value for money”
Reviews.Author: sardinia2009
Reviews.Content: we booked this four star hotel in Rome Italy because we wished to stay near the Vatican City and this choice was with nova domus hotel the perfect one. this good four star hotel is at just 5 minutes walking distance from the Vatican Museum and 10 minutes from Saint Peter Square. The subway station : Cipro Musei Vaticani, is at only 500 meter from this four star hotel. we ( me my wife, and two children) booked a family room: in the setting are was a tein bed for the children and in the slepping room a king bed for me and my wife. the bath oom was superb with a jucuzzi bath-tub. the staf is very professional and frinedly. gwe had our dinner at the terrace restaurant , the service was good and the food was excellent. The prices for the family room and even for the dinners were very reasonable, we will suggest the Nova Domus Hotel for good value for money

Reviews.Title: “BE AWARE OF THIVIES”
Reviews.Author: universe1911
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Rome July 16th, 2009. Shocked what happened to us in Nova Domus Hotel. Someone entered into our room while we were out, and stole 620 euro from the hidden place. I always kept the money with me, only 2 days before our leave I decided to seperate the money that I wanted to pay the hotel bill, and hide it in my luggage, in a very safetly place which I thought. Looks like someone was following us every day,and then we were not there, they entered and did their dirty job. The reason I didn't put the money in safety box , because a lot of people were telling me that their money got stolen from safety box too, not specificly from that hotel. So I reported the hotel management and the police station. Police officer was laughing and saying that your money is gone. "Thank you for letting me know that." Hotel personnel was helpful but was speachless, especially the manager. He gave me 10% discount. Thank you for that, but the fact that they have an employee who is after tourists money is a reality. They said I should've keep valuables in safebox. I explained them how about I have very expensive clothes, or coat, how I can keep it in the safebox. Someone from their employees is a thief. I felt so unsecure in that hotel. The strange feeling was following me that any minute they could've enter and even put a gun on our head to ask money, as long as they had the key and could've done that very professionally with no signs of robbery. That's the feeling stayed with me when I left Italy. Other than that Italians are good people, and Rome is nice. Find hotels next to Termini or Piazza Popolo. For the airport Shuttle from your hotel call [--]. You will pay 28 euro and plus 6euro for each person, or else hotel will offer you to pay 65euro. For tours it is better to talk to the right agent and you will get bargain prices. For open bus tours we paid 12euro for each of us, hotel was offering 19euro. For metros and busses get a 3 day pass, and all day long you can use bus or metro to any where, so you can save money. There is a market on Sundays at Porta Portese. You can get a lot of things with very good price, but be aware of thieves again. When you go to musuems your shoulders should be covered, keep a scarf or jacket with you. I went to Villa Borgese, and it is far away and they said they are full, it means it is better to check that you can enter and then go there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: djpart1230
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel online due to its location. It is literally on the "street" to the Vatican City. The hotel Desk clerks speak excellent English, and are extremely helpful in any area you need. We arrived about 11:30 and check in is at 2:00. We expected to wait, but were given our room immediately. The staff brought our luggage up. I think if we would have asked them to unpack our suitcases, they would have! The hotel is very sharp. It has a lot of beautiful plants and greenery. The waiting are is extremely inviting! Elevator or stairs to the 5 floors. A large restaurant which serves a contiental breakfast (cheeses, meats, eggs, rolls, sweet rolls, drinks of all kinds, and so many other assortments). You have the option of sitting indoors or out on the patio (where little birds might peek at you while you are eating). The patio is lovely with beautiful plants and trees in large terracotta containers. The food was excellent. The restaurant is open for dinner as well, however, we were never there for dinner...Always out seeing the sights! They also have a "lounge" at the top of the building where you can sit ad have a drink (alcohol or non-alcohol) and look out onto the streets and see Rome as the evening approaches. You view so many beautiful window plants and so many trees and plants on the roofs! The hallways are very wide... not your usual narrow European hallways. Two wheelchairs could go side by side! The halls are decorated with beautiful artwork from ancient and current Italy. The room really surprised us! We have traveled extensively in Europe and always have had a "small" room where you can hardly have space to sit. But to our surprise, when we opened the door, it was so roomy and beautiful. The bathroom was much larger than expected. One could shower and the other shave or whatever... Also they had a blowdryer available. Many little toiletries available. Good size shower and good water pressure. They also have a "bideau" (not sure of spelling). There was a very large wall closet for hanging clothes and drawers for other clothing. A small wall safe was also in the room. The bed was good size and so very comfortable! I have a bad back and each night, after walking all day, my back was THANKFUL for the mattress on the bed. We had a large window that opened up and we could look down onto the stree. We had a neighbor across the way with a dog (a white dog with one large area of black over his eye) who would sit in the window and watch the traffic. (We were in room 210) So European... it was great. Also an A/C that worked great, but we love the fresh air and used the open window at night. The area was quiet (Thank God!) so we were able to sleep very comfortably. There was a small TV that got many stations but only one in English (CNN). We aren't big TV watchers so we read our books, and usually fell dead asleep quickly. The room was done up every day (we stayed 4 days) . It almost seemed like she redid the sheets daily... So clean and crisp! Any personal items stayed as put. There were new towels etc every day. The maids were all dressed like "the Nanny". They were so cute! There was a large bureau with a large mirror and a top drawer for makeup, papers, whatever. The hotel is a quick walk to grocery stores, shops, bus stop, Metro and the BEST ice cream shop is right across the street! You get 3 scoops of any kind. The two of us had one every day and only paid 4.50 Euro for the both of them! My overall opinion is that I WILL go back to that hotel the next time I go to Rome. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, even people with disabilities. You won't be disappointed, I promise you!

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star more like a 2.5 in the US”
Reviews.Author: Bluestraveler_9
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip on hotwire. Usually I don't have a problem. This time I was dissapointed. The hotel has nice hallways but that is where is stops. The rooms are dark and beat up. The paint on the walls did not match the paint on the same wall. Ceiling tiles where stained. Granted you are not there to watch TV but they have a black and white 15 inch. It would be worth more to them as an antique. Carpets were worn. Bathrooms where dark and have one florecent light that flickered and made you look like a zombie. The chair in the room had stains on it. The one good thing was that the breakfast was included and it was ok. 15 min walk to the vatican is true.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: gxp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nova Domus for 4 nights and were very satisfied. Not sure about the 4*, but were not expecting much for the price. Rooms were clean and large, Bathroom was modern with Jacuzzi tub. Some complained about shutters but we found most hotels in Italy had shutters on the windows and there is a pull strap beside the window to open them. The location was convenient to the Vatican, about 10 minutes, and shopping. The centre of Rome, especially Piazza Navona, are best reached by the Metro, and the station is less than a 10 minute walk. As mentioned, the Chinese/Japanese restaurant across the street is a bargain and very good. Breakfasts were good, and pleasant on the open terrace. The farmers market down the street was pleasant. We found it best to walk or ride to central Rome and take a cab back if it was late.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value + Good Location”
Reviews.Author: a786374534
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 10 minutes away from Vatican by walking; that is why we chose it. We paid about $119/night including taxes and found it to be a great value for the money. Breakfast was good; we had dinner at their restaurant once (on the terrace) which was good too. Overall, we liked the location, breakfast (cappuccino was very good, even if from a machine), room was not bad, even though clearly not new.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, Dirty and very outdated.”
Reviews.Author: MollyPotter2009
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Expedia and it seemed to be quite a reasonable price for Rome. We were quite hopeful that it would be a decent hotel in a good location, however we were sadly mistaken. I cannot begin to fathom how this hotel earned a 4* rating, it is definitely more like a European 2*. The hotel is certainly not a five minute walk to/from Cipro metro station, and I consider myself a very fast walker, it is at least fifteen minutes down a very long road. Regarding location again the hotel is about ten minutes from the VATICAN MUSEUM, but a good twenty five minutes from the actual Vatican (St Peter's Square). There are no shops about to buy drinks/snacks from and the hotel is miles away from the other central attractions, but this isn't really a problem if you use the metro. Our room was on the second floor and upon arrival we immediately noticed how dark the room was, there was hardly any natural light at all seemed to be obscured by horrid hurricane like shutters that could not be moved up or down. The room was very hot, AC not working and we had a lovely view of a basketball court. Beds are like sleeping on a concrete slab with matching slab pillows; I have never in my life slept on such uncomfortable beds. Other than that room size not too bad, had a nice LCD TV but with no English channels at all, BEWARE internet is thirty five cents per minute. The staff were very unhelpful, on three separate occasions did we request extra pillows, we were pointed in the wrong direction twice to the nearest shop and there porter who carried the bags seemed to be loitering outside our room whenever we left/came back to the hotel. We were also made to wait to be seen whilst the receptionist spoke on the phone several times, breakfast as mentioned by previous guests was not something to write home about. We arrived everyday at 8:15am and the eggs/bacon looked to have been there all night, dirty culterly, juice so watered down I couldn't even tell what flavour it was and bread so hard it could have been used as a weapon. All this luxury was provided in what could have passed for a tomb it was so dark, I have no idea why they didn't open the curtains; my only though is that doing so would mean they'd have to clean the windows, which obviously is something that hasn't been done since the late 1990s. Overall this hotel was a major disappointment, the location was horrid, the actual hotel was depressing, dark, dirty and very very outdated. DO NOT STAY HERE!! Only recommendation I can make is the Chinese/Japanese restaurant 'Wok' facing the hotel it really is lovely and very cheap too.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: forte22
Reviews.Content: I do not understand the bad reviews!!?? I have stayed through out Italy France Switerzland South Pacific and the U.S.A.and found this hotel to be fine. My room was clean the staff was friendly and the breakfast was good. The Vatican was close and there were good restaurants on Via Andrea Adora and other close locations. The indoor Farmers Market was great and almost at your door step.The Metro was not that far away and from there you could easily get to other sections of Rome. You can also do some walking!! I stayed 6 days and the front desk people were always friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to friends and hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awfull Hotel.. Take note of reviews..”
Reviews.Author: liverpoolclaire2008
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through expedia, 2 adults 2 children. The metro is not 5 mins away but a good 15 min walk and with suitcases and bags was awfull. On arrival we were given a map of Rome and shown to our room. The hotel is dark, dirty and in much need of an renovation. Our room had the shutters down so no natural sunlight.The beds were like sleeping on concrete and the air con did not work. Which considering it was over 70 degrees was a nightmere. The staff were not pariculary helpfull. The breakfast was vile. Dirty tables,food left in a stainless steel food warmer for what looked like hours. Very little choice of food. The local attractions are only reachable via metro,unless you are prepared to walk for miles and miles or be ripped off in a taxi. The Vatacin is a good 25 min walk to the main entrance, the Vatican museum is approx 10 min walk away. I would never stay in this hotel again, its shabby,dirty and in a poor location, in the middle of a residental area. We had a view of a football court and blocks of flats. I would never recommend this hotel and it should not be classed as 4 star but 2 star would be better suited. Worst hotel I have ever stayed in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Don't say you weren't warned”
Reviews.Author: AdventureGuru
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via a pre-paid web site and admit the price was good compared to most hotels in Rome. But, it was a big mistake, one I won't soon make again. I was quite disappointed that it was billed as a 4-star hotel on the site. I don't think I would give it more than 2 stars personally. The room was dark, very outdated and dirty. The shower curtain was stained and there were scuff marks all over the tub. The carpet was filthy and shabby. The bed spread was old and outdated. The TV looked to be from the 80s. This hotel is badly in need of a renovation and amenity facelift. The breakfast was ok. The staff didn't change the stained tableclothes between uses. The only highpoint from my point of view was the location. It was very close to the Vatican and a short walk to the Metro. However, I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: maybemedk
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back home from a 4 nights vacation in rome, we stayed at the Nova Domus hotel and suites, and I must say that I was a bit worried after reading some of the reviews on this site, but we were plesantly surprised, the hotel was nice and not at all dirty as I read some one said. The staff was all very sweet and helpfull, and the rooms nice. The only thing to put a finger on is the location, it is ok close to the metro and the vatican, and we had no problem getting around to the sights, but the next time I go to Rome I will choose a hotel closer to the Termini or Piazza Navona. But all in all a good hotel I would recomend if you have no problem that it is a good walk from most of the sights. (btw. sorry for my poor english, I am from Denmark and english is not my native language)

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: DollyNY
Reviews.Content: It was extemely dirty and the staff at the front desk was very prejudice against american citizens. I was yelled at because my suitcase hit the stairs and made a loud noise. I explained to the man at the front desk that the elavator was not working and I had to take the stairs with my two suitcases and he made many hand gestures at me. I did notice how nice he was to French and Italian citizens. The walls and floors in the Resturant had dirt and red sauce all over them. Staying at this hotel ruined my trip to Rome. I will never go to Italy again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good Value Hotel Room”
Reviews.Author: foodlover_PA
Reviews.Content: It is a ten minutes walk from the Cipro Metro Station to the hotel. We booked a triple room and got two twin beds and two twin sofa beds (a quad room?). It was a very good size room for the three of us. We have two TVs and a big bathroom. The breakfast buffet was more than adequate as compared to the US budget hotels (waffle makers and scrambled eggs). The hotel was full of Globus tour guests so watch out when the tour guests are having their breakfast so you can avoid the crowd. The front desk called a cab for us early in the morning (3:30 am). Overall, we are very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay in a wonderful city.”
Reviews.Author: SwanseaDaytripper
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews before our trip,we were confident that we would have a wonderful long week-end in a sunny Rome at its spring-time best.The Nova Domus is dated and in desperate need of a refurbishment and a good spring-clean.The look was not helped by heavy drapes and dusty dried flower arrangements,combined with marked walls,chipped furniture and overall a look that doesn't seem as though it's been touched since the 70's.The warm rooms were not helped by air-conditioning that pushed out hot air so that you have to sleep with the windows open and endure night long traffic noise.The breakfast,in an uninspiring dining room, would be adequate were it not for the inedible attempts at a hot selection of bacon and eggs.The location is handy for the Vatican but a good Metro ride from anything else you may wish to see.All this would be almost excusable were it not for the disinterested staff,cold -just this side of rude.Rome-we'll be back but not to this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Would do it again”
Reviews.Author: petitverdot
Reviews.Content: I have been to Rome over a dozen times on business, and stay at a hotel near the Pantheon that charges three times the Novo Domus rate, with almost no difference in room size or quality. For this vacation trip, my wife and I selected the Novo Domus, and would do it again. I would echo what everyone else has said, with a few additions. Breakfast is more than adequate. Not gourmet, but if you are used to European offerings at this price level, above average. If you make a left out of the hotel and head to the Vatican Museum entrance, there is an indoor farmer's market about five blocks away which we used for fruits/vegetables and cheese for our light afternoon meal. This was a pleasant surprise that I had not seen mentioned on this site, and we really enjoyed it. A real Roman flavor. With the exception of using the train/metro/walk from the airport to the hotel on arrival and departure, we did all of our touring on foot. We greatly enjoyed it. The location is perfect for the Vatican, but unless you are willing to walk, which we greatly enjoy, the other attractions are a hike. Our normal day was breakfast at the hotel, morning walk to the attractions, farmer's market for fruit/bread /cheese eaten at the hotel, then afternoon walk to next goal, dinner in Trastevere, and back to the hotel. Very happy with our hotel decision. Very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: triona64
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nova Domus was great. Value for money, friendly staff, bedroom great, breakfast was lovely. Great selection of foods and more than adequate to set you up for the day. The room was lovely and warm as we were there in wet and cold weather. Location very near the Vatican and within easy reach of Metro. PLEASE PLEASE beware of Italian taximen. We were totally ripped off. €96 euro fare from Ciampino and he extracted another €50 from my husband by confusing him with notes. He gave him two €50's and he switched a €50 for a €10 and persuaded him he only gave him €60 So he actually charged us €140 We walked straight into his trap. We didnt argue with him, it was dark and he was a nasty looking guy. Dont go near them, it doesnt matter what marking they have on the taxis you just dont know, take the bus for a fare of about €8 It was very upsetting but the Nova Domus Hotel made up for the horrible incident we encountered when we were only about three minutes on Italian soil. Well done Nova Domus.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome !”
Reviews.Author: billynoodle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently visited Rome for 4 days. We stayed at the Quality Nova Domus Hotel during our stay. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The room itself was clean and the bed very comfortable. The food within the hotel though we only had breakfast was quite good. The only complaint I would have regarding the hotel was the the fact the walls were a little thin or the people in the next room were very noisy. Rome itself is probably like many other large cities within Europe and has a massive diversity in cultures. There are some wondeful placs to visit within Rome but I think our favourite was the Castle on the banks of the River Tiber. Well worth the fare to get in. Visited most places during our visit, Collosseum, Vatican City, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps etc. All worth a visit. My only complaint regarding Rome is the people themselves. My word, Rome may ahve been the first City to be established but it appears that it people have run out of manners during their long existance. The police were rude if you asked for help regarding anything, they were only interested in smoking whilst trying to look at passing females whilst worrying about how they looked. The residents of Rome have no time for anyone but themselves and if they start any conversation with you they are shortly going to ask you for some money. They walk into you on the street and don not apologise, but only give you a condescending grunt or look. My overview, glad I went but I would not go back due to the people of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal_clearIreland
Reviews.Content: We satyed here on the recommendation of my brother. It was very easy to get to and the staff were helpful and friendly. the rooms were clean, tidy and cool. Loved the breakfast as it was plentiful and set us up for the day ahead. Vatican Museum and St Peters sq are 10-15 minute walk away and in fact we walked everywhere as there was so much to see. The cocktails in the small but peaceful bar, was very welcome each evening and measures pleantiful!! Lovely Chinese restaurant across the street which was inexpensive and recommended. When we go back to Rome, we will definately go back to Nova Domus!!

Reviews.Title: “mmmm....”
Reviews.Author: Tara023
Reviews.Content: Okay... We stayed in Venice in a beautiful Villa, then stopped off in Rome. I was quite realistic about the place we had booked, as I had seen some of the reviews. I expected a small room and nothing special. I have to say my expectations were matched. I was looking for more, really I was but... nothing. I am honestly suprised it's 4*? Maybe 3 but definitely not 4. When we arrived the receptionist was quite helpful. The porter took us to our room. Before I could tip the guy he had walked off? Strange. We couldn't really walk around in the room as it was so small. The room looked worna and smelt of smoke. I remembered what someone put on this website 'if the bathrooms not new, your in an old room.' I called the recpetionist straight away (actually I sent my other half to do the man thing) He came back with the porter and we went to the 4th Floor, the hallways were different, in fact everything was! The room was the same size but nicer, especially the bathroom. The porter wasnt very happy about us changing the room and walked off in a little bit of a huff. Okay for food we went to a lovely Italian, the receptionist recommended it. We had so much fun, and the waiter was so funny. Second night we went to a lovely mexican, Highly recommend it it's about 15 mins from the hotel. Lastly we went to Trevestre for a lovely Greek meal. We figured that the more we got lost in the back streets the cheaper the food was. I'd say this hotel is fine. But wouldnt go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: vegasman55
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying 5 nights at the Nova Domus. On arrival, the reception staff were very friendly and efficient, our bags being carried up to our room by the porter. The room was quite adequate, very clean with modern decor. The bathroom was very nice and the shower great. The breakfast in the morning was very good with a large choice of food to suit everyone. The location of the Domus was very good, only a 10 minute walk to the nearest Metro station (Cipro). St. Peter's square was only a 20 minute walk away and all the other attractions were easily reachable. Rome itself was very scruffy with grafitti everywhere,which spoiled the look of this famous city. The prices of food and drink were extortionate.(5e for a soft drink)Try and find a supermarket where the prices were reasonable. My tip would be to buy a 4euro ticket for the day which allows you unlimited travel on the Metro, tram or bus. All in all i would definitely recommend the Nova Domus, but be warned, take a lot of spending money if you want to enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what we were planning on”
Reviews.Author: Dallasite7
Reviews.Content: WE booked this Hotel mostly because it advertiised how close it was to the Vatican. Our trip to Italy included a day or two at the Vatican.Once we arrived it was not as close as we wanted ,especially if we wanted to spend some time in St.Peters Square at night enjoying the fountains.The general area was run down and did not seem safe after dark as far as walking goes. The Staff was helpful and friendly . Our room however was small ,in need of some work and since there was no AC the windows had to be left open for ventilation but the windows had no screens.We seemed to be awakened off and on all night long.there was either car alarms going off or ambulances .One night we heard fireworks and screaming. The night traffic was loud at times since we faced a busy street.The bed however was very comfortable so that was a plus. The breakfast was excellent .nice dining rooms also.However the dinners were over priced and servings small. For what we paid for this Hotel I expected better.It was nothing like we had hoped for.The surrounding areas outside the Hotel had little to offer either as far as other alternative restaurants that were convenient to get to and there was very little shopping in the immediate area. Dallasite 07 USA

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Aa_Finn
Reviews.Content: Our family had a wonderful stay at Hotel Nova Domus on our first trip to Rome in October 2008. Nova Domus is nicely located in a quiet area of the city and at a walking distance from the Vatican. Just 5-10 minutes walk from the hotel, there's an underground station Cipro, where you can take the underground to the historic center - very convenient. We stayed 5 days in Rome and bought a one-week ticket (17 e) for each of us. That was very convenient for us when traveling around without worrying about tickets, and we used both the buses and the underground a lot. There's a stop for two long bus lines conveniently just outside the hotel. We stayed 4 nights at a 4-person room, which was perfect for us - two adults and two teen-age kids (15 and 18). We first considered the family room, which looks nice on the photos, but checked the size of the beds from the hotel and found out that the children's beds are just 180 cm long. Since our son is 190 cm long, the quadruple room with 4 normal length beds was a better alternative for us. The main room was large with 3 beds, and it was adjoined with a single-room-size entrance room with one bed. It looked like kids' beds had extra hideaway beds underneath. However, the size of the room was just perfect for the 4 of us. The breakfast room was nice with a good variation of foods and drinks. The hotel personnel was very helpful. The advised us about a small Internet cafe across the street and up the stairs round corner. Just 1,50 e per hour - much appreciated by our kids. (The hotel also has an in-house internet workstation on the first floor, but it costs 5 e per 15 minutes!). When we were checking, the hotel personnel offered to get a taxi for us in the evening to take us to the airport. The price 50 e for all four of us was very reasonable (the train tickets from Termini to the airport would have been 44 e) and we were saved from dragging our luggage in the underground and standing in the train corridor all the way as we had to do on arrival. The taxi was nice and modern, however driver drove like a maniac - 170 km/h on the motor highway, but at the end we got to the airport safe and sound. The price level at Nova Domus is much more favorable than in the very touristic center of the city. For us with 4 persons on board, that makes a difference. The price of the room at Hotel Nova Domus is also much depending on where you book it.

Reviews.Title: “thanks tripadvisor find a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: izzen
Reviews.Content: thanks to the review i have seen on tripadvisor i find the nova domus hotel the correct hotel for my neeed. good location near the vatican, WI.FI. , large room and good assistance from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Check bathroom before unpacking”
Reviews.Author: MaryleeP
Reviews.Content: Bathrooms are uneven, some updated, some not. Ask for a change if you get one of the old ones. The location is good for the Vatican. Big daily street market two blocks away. Right on a convenient bus line to most of the major sights in the city. Breakfast was only fair. About five blocks to the subway. We stayed in three hotels on our recent trip to Italy. This was the only one that had English language newspapers available.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly ok”
Reviews.Author: cocochiquita
Reviews.Content: Well, seeing as this was a real bargain, and I actually booked it unnamed as well, I was pleasantly surprised with what I found. Yes, some bits were slightly rough around the edges, but we were pleased with what we found - a comfy bed (with extra blankets and pillows in wardrobe!) a shower, free safe (yes, a free one!) etc. Hotel is about 10mins walk from Vatican so this is fab, and metro links into the centre of Rome itself are cheap and quick. Alternatively do what we did and get a tourist bus - €20 for 48hrs unlimited stops. Only quibble I have with hotel is the breakfast room - lots of big tables but none really in 2's, so we had to sit with others. Not a problem for us, but some we sat on table with were not particularly taken with the idea!!
