If you're eating out, there isn't much in close proximity to the hotel, but the one we did eat in nearby (over near the fruit and veg stalls at side of the road) served us fab grub....not traditionally italian, but I had the best fresh grilled scampi ever, menus are slightly pricier than pizzerias etc but it was classy and well worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Try it for yourself”
Reviews.Author: kath16
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2 night stay for myself and my boyfriend to Rome staying at the Nova Domus Hotel through a discount hotels website. Effectively, because the room rate advertised was so low, I had to book blind. All I was told until payment had been confirmed was that it was a 4* hotel, double room bed and breakfast for 2 nights within walking distance of the Vatican. Considering the price I paid (extremely reasonable) I was extremely chuffed. However this did not last long once I read the reviews. I was absolutely dreading going and really was expecting the worst. However I am very pleased to say that we had a lovely stay and would therefore offer some advice to potential travellers: 1) Start by acknowledging that a 4* Italien hotel (and European in general) is not the same as a 4* Hotel in the Far East for example. Also, I am of the opinion that more people are likely to write a review when returning if they had a very bad experience so bare that in mind - the reviews may not be representative. 2) Generally you get what you pay for - shop around when booking at this hotel, do not pay what you would expect to pay for a 4* in London for example. 3) The cable tv does not work properly - we had no English channels at all in our first room and only CNN in the second but surely you are going to Rome to see the city?? Not sit in a hotel room so we found this acceptable as background noise in the morning. 4) The hotel is not in the nicest of areas - it is down the backstreets. Possibly why room rate can be foudn so cheaply. However it really is within 10 minutes walk of the Vatican and there are many restaurants and ice cream parlours within walking distance. The best meal we had was at a family run restaurant near the hotel. 5) The metro is cheao however we found the best way to see the city was to get a 48hr ticket for the green "Rome Open Top Bus". This picks up at the Vatican and proved a convenient method of seeing the city, getting back to the hotel and airport. 6) Breakfast - not great. Eggs and bacon were scrummy. There is cereal and bread but rather limited. But it did the trick. More room for pizza fro lunch! 7) Hotel staff - the porter was very unfriendly but the reception staff were most helpful, particularly when the shutter on our door broke and when we requested to move rooms. The bar area is nice to relax in and the barman accommodating. 8) In line with other reviews - it was very noisy in the morning - the housekeeping staff made so much noise they might aswell have been in the room with us however at least it made us get out of bed early to see the sights! Overall I would say I enjoyed my stay at the Nova Domus BUT GO WITH REALISTIC EXPECTATIONS. If you want "proper" 4 or 5* luxury they are much nicer hotels in the more central areas of the city. However for what we were looking for it was perfectly adequate given the cheap rate. If you have already booked when reading these reviews like I had, DO NOT PANIC. A side note not connected to the hotel - avoid the restaurant opposite the Colloseum which is in guidebooks. After making us wait 40 minutes for 2 pizzas as the waited had forgotten to submit the order TWICE, and with no apology, they then tryed to overcharge us by 20 Euros. I questioned the waiter at which point (in front of ym very eyes) he edited the bill but still overcharge us on the drinks. It does not cost £8 for Coke even opposite the Colloseum. I had to ask a waitress for the correct price at which point I confronted the waiter to say it wasn't the first price, or the second but in actual fact it was the price I had worked our. Lesson: they will rip you off!

Reviews.Title: “An old and tired hotel near the vatican”
Reviews.Author: extra0rdinary
Reviews.Content: All i require from a basic room would be a working shower, toilet, clean bed and window. On the above points the Hotel Nova Domus did not disappoint, on everything else it did. The hotel is extremely tired and battered (except for the foyer and reception). Our room was adequate and we didn't spend much time in it so it didn't really matter what it looked like. The sheets, towels and bathroom were clean, the wardrobe and walls, curtains and windows were filthy. I didn't dare touch the air con for fear of electrocution. The TV was 20 years old with two fuzzy channels (italian and CNN). The toilet wasn't fixed to the floor properly so wobbled when sat on. The cold water from the sink kept running out completely but was OK if left for 5 mins. The cooked breakfast was absolutely revolting however there was also a full continental breakfast offering which was fine. If you arrived at breakfast late (after 9) the restaurant was still full of everyone else's dirty plates which you had to move yourself to get a seat at a table. Despite all this we got what we paid for (£56 a night for a double room), the hotel is only 10 mins walk from the Vatican and Cipro Metro station and the staff are friendly so had an enjoyable weekend. This was one of those LastMinute.com secret 4* hotels - it was certainly NOT a 4 star hotel, maybe a low 3 star and it is also NOT recently renovated but what else would you get this cheap?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: winemanKent,England
Reviews.Content: Having booked hotel prior to reading reviews was somewhat apprehensive on checking in but all fear were groundless. Rooms were of good size and very clean, and cleaned daily. Service was good and very helpful. The breakfast was superb. Would have no hesitation in returning to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “use this hotel at your own risk...would not recommend it!!!”
Reviews.Author: TT777
Reviews.Content: First I would like to say Thank You to Brunno, he was fantastic the entire time we were there and was very helpful in the following incident we had experienced at this hotel. This is the ONLY reason the hotel recieved the service score that they did! My family stayed at this hotel for three days. We had to rooms next to each other. The door jams on both our rooms were very loose or broken. Later that night, my brother had informed the front desk of this situation and the Porter assured them that it was not a problem and the rooms cannot be broken in to. The next morning I looked closer at my door and lock and took my grocery club card and opened the door in less than five seconds, and did the same to my brothers room. I went down to the front desk and asked if we could switch rooms, we checked the doors on those rooms and they had the same problem. In fact the porter had me check the doors first with my grocery card first and I was able to open five more rooms. We finally found one room that we could not open with the card. Then we returned later that night and our luggage was still left in the other rooms. The next night we went out to dinner, gone a few hours and our room was broken in to. Our luggage had been taken out of the closet and gone through. They had stolen any electronic device that was out or put away in luggage. ie, digital camera that couldn't fit in thier shoebox size safe, and a cell phone. Fortunately everything else was in the safe and we had the key with us. The Carbanieri was called and during the investigation they found that they were able to enter the room with just the "Do Not Disturb" paper sign. He folded it in half and was in the room in less than ten seconds. We were asked to go to the Carbaneries' station the next day to complete a report a report but they "didn't speak english" and didn't understand. Well they were able to say that with clarity in english!!! In the end the Hotel did comp our stay but did not equate to the loss that we incurred. I would not recommend you stay at this hotel until they do some modifications to the safety and security of their doors. And probably terminate that lousy porter!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Definately not 4 star, struggles to be 3 star”
Reviews.Author: incrediblepie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and was very disappointed. The hotel is in terrible need of a renovation. Our room was quite small - not tiny - and was very badly maintained. Some points. Bathroom there was NO air extraction unit, there was NO bidet. sink unit was tiny, badly lit and obstructed by a shelf unit. Paint and flooring need to renovated but in general was clean and usable. Bedroom - very very dark. No central light? Only three table lamps, very strange indeed. Tiny, TV unit. Carpets looked dated and needed to be replaced. The room in general was low quality. Also there seemed to be a drainage pipe passing above our ceiling so there was a continuous (loud) noise of draining water when the room upstairs used the bathroom. v bad! Breakfast - standard hotel fare, not worth getting out of bed for it really. Worst coffee i have ever tasted. On the upside, staff v friendly and hotel well positioned near metro station. Bottom line.... if you get this hotel at about 50 euro per night its worth the money, but dont go if you looking for 4 star quality

Reviews.Title: “Just adequate”
Reviews.Author: Pakiha
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was a quick 10 mins walk from the Vatican, though the streets were a little scummy. The rooms were clean but nothing special, the beds/ pillows were hard and air conditioning was non-existent. If fact when we called reception over the airconditioning, the solution they had to this was to "open a window". Breakfast also was nothing special, though servicable with a selection of cereal, sweet breads and mushy eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible for a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Sang_Smith
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel shocking for a four star. It was on a very filthy street in a filthy neighbourhood. Upon entrance the whole place stank. Our double room was horrible, stank of cigarettes. All the furniture is old and smelly and unacceptable for a four star. Luckily the bed and shower were clean. The worst was the breakfast room, we had gone into the room at 4pm the day before and saw that the morning's breakfast breads and food were lying aorund in their baskets open to flies. That same basket of food was served the next day! Please do not book this place.

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant staff”
Reviews.Author: geo55
Reviews.Content: I travel very often to Italy for business, but this time I decided to come with my wife in an organized trip. We stayed in this hotel by the end of July with my wife. The hotel is very nice, rooms clean and the Vatican is only a few minutes walk away!. Despite all this, I had very unpleasant stay in this hotel! I would have never expected such a bad behaviour from some of the staff, especially the restaurant staff. We never saw the smile on their face and a waitress by the name Lara, was very rude during the breakfast. Many people from the group were really surprised and angry, because she was treating us as very bad, calling the people of my nation with different dirty and offending names! Unbelievable for a hotel like this! Even for the dinner we were not treated better by the headwaiter and this was really a bad experience from this nice hotel. It’s true that sometimes the staff makes the place, and even if the place to stay is beautiful with staff like this, I will never come back on my future trips to Rome, in this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “good position”
Reviews.Author: quarduple
Reviews.Content: Nova Domus has a good position, near Vatican and Metro (Cipro, A-line). The staff was friendly and helpful. The quadruple room was big enough and tidy. There were many choices at breakfast but the room was too small at rush hour. We recommend. Quadruple

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, shame about our room”
Reviews.Author: Herwin
Reviews.Content: The staff were lovely. My friends and I booked two rooms. Upon arrival I checked in without any problems, but my friends checked in at 8pm and were told their reservation had been cancelled. Staff worked hard to accommodate them and did, in a room far more superior to ours. I'd say the rooms are of a good three star standard - maybe we were just unlucky and got a basic room - as the other room had a spa bath whereas ours just had a shower. The toiletries were quite basic too (very three star) and our bathroom cramped. Our beds were very soft - we were in room 411 I think - and our friends' was fine. Maybe we were unlucky and got a bad room. The staff made up for everything however. Bruno, close to retirement, adopted us girls and arranged flowers for a birthday. The terrace was lovely at breakfast, the restaurant is slightly overpriced - the usual with hotels I suppose. There's a lovely restaurant down the road. It is 5 mins from the Vatican and about under 10 mins from nearest metro if you don't feel like walking in to central Rome. We walked everywhere once we found our bearings. Would stay here again, as I've seen most of Rome now and don't need to stay in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: caniscorpus
Reviews.Content: Can,t say anything good about the room. The bathroom sink outlet was partly blocked and water took ages to drain away. The shower tap was very stiff and difficult to regulate. Only one night out of three were we given a bath mat. The twin beds were like camp beds - a steel frame with exposed mesh springing. Noisy creaking everytime I moved that disturbed my wife. Her bedside light was hanging off the wall. When she pressed her switch this and the dressing table light fused. Only used the restaurant for buffet breakfast. Limited choice and quite a scrum round the coffee machine. I thought that in a four star hotel the staff should have served coffe at the table. The bar lacked any windows and is wedged in a mezzanine. My wife asked the bargirl for two American dry ginger ales. The girl was preoccupied with a long telephone conversation but eventually she said this was not available. On being asked what soft drinks she stocked, she then produced ginger ale. Just off the bar is a terrace along one side of the hotel. This could be made quite pleasant for an outside drink but no attempt has been made to provide chairs or sunshades etc. Location is only good for the Vatican and that can be seen from the restaurant terrace. Yes as others have commented the Cipro metro station is a short distance away. There are some nice street restaurants quite close - La Fiorentina in Via Andrea Doria and and La Caravella in Via degli Scipioni . Make sure you check the bill in the former as tourist rip offs will be attempted. We were staying in this hotel as part of a package tour of Italy - we would never choose this hotel if we were booking our own hotel accomodation

Reviews.Title: “great if you like noise, overpriced food and thievery”
Reviews.Author: dazeke
Reviews.Content: Climate control means "open your window". If loud traffic noises bother you then you are in trouble. I'm surprised they don't charge you to look at the menu as overpriced the food is. If you stay here, go elsewhere to eat. Also secure EVERYTHING. I have had money and an item stolen valued at over US$600. Hotel staff blows it off, prefering to blame the customer. I have stayed at 100s of hotels around the world and I have NEVER had any issues whatsoever until Nova Domus. If you have any choice, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: seethesightsforless
Reviews.Content: We are travel agents and have stayed in many hotels. Hotel Nova Domus is exceptional. The location of this hotel makes walking to most attractions very easy. It is actually right down the street from Vatican City. The staff was excellent as they would help with any arrangements needed. Their breafast selection was one of the best we have ever had. This was one hotel where we actually got our monies worth. We could go on and on but simply put, look no further, stay at the Hotel Nova Domus for a great stay in Rome...

Reviews.Title: “NICE”
Reviews.Author: Arlette09
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights and it was a very pleasant stay. Big comfortable clean room, nice bathroom and friendly staff. The breakfast was ok; a lot of choice and delicious things to start the day with.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars at best”
Reviews.Author: powertripper
Reviews.Content: I dont know where this hotel got a 4 star rating from, but its defintely not! the staff on more than one occasion gave us wrong information on museums and dining in the area. the hotel resturant served cold food and bad fish. the bathroom had no windows or vents and was musty all the time, also the bath products were of very cheap quality. the staff was very friendly but didnt know much. In the room there was no iron for our clothes and the noise from other rooms bled right thru the walls. the lobby was pretty nice, but when you walked outside the street in front was littered and full of dog poop. We had stayed at 4star hotels all over italy with no problems, to this hotel we will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in quiet residential area”
Reviews.Author: Moira.mac
Reviews.Content: End July 2006: This was our first trip to Rome, and also our honeymoon. We were very impressed with the hotel, all the staff and the location. Our 2nd floor room was not too large, but big enough when we were planning to be out sightseeing most of the time. The room and bathroom were clean, and it was great that they had little cards that you left on the bed if you didn't want the sheets changed everyday. The shower did leak all over the bathroom floor, as another reviewer commented, but this was a minor irritation. The balcony did have scaffolding at one end, but this didn't really bother us, and whenever we went onto the balcony, no-one else was there, so the fact that it was shared was not an issue. It was great having the airconditioning and window shutter, as the temperature was around 38C. There was an ice machine on the ground floor that could be used at anytime, although it did run out some evenings when a lot of people used it. We just went back later when it was full again. The breakfast was varied and, after the first morning we went down at around 8.10 as we knew that fresh eggs and bacon would be available. All the staff were polite and very helpful. They all spoke excellent english, one of the restaurant waitresses even helped me with my italian pronunciation. Even the chambermaids were polite when we passed them in the mornings. The barman was very helpful and we had no problems getting cold drinks as one reviewer stated. My only complaint was not being able to get a cup of tea unless the restaurant was open. There were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room, but this may be the italian way. I'm just going to invest in a travel kettle- problem solved!! The location of the hotel was great for us as we live in rural Ireland, where it is very quiet. We liked being in a quiet residential area, and there were plenty of shops and cafes within a short walk. There was even a McDonalds about 20-30 minute walk away. It was very pleasant strolling along to it one evening, but don't ask for a quarter pounder, they don't seem to have them in italy- either that or our garbled italian just made no sense! The walk to the Vatican took about 10 minutes straight down the road, although we did get lost on the frst evening and took about 30-45 minutes to find St Peter's square. Just serves us right for not using the complimentary map supplied by the hotel. We used most of the cafes in the area and, with the exception of one (can't remember the name) the service was great and the prices reasonable; all the staff were polite and most spoke some english. When we originally considered visiting Rome, we looked at hotels in the city centre, around the Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain. Having now been, we are so glad that we chose to stay at the Nova Domus as it was so peaceful. I think the city centre area would have been too noisy at night. So if your looking for a quiet hotel that's reasonably close to the sights, we would recommend the Hotel Nova Domus, so much so that we have booked for next july already.

Reviews.Title: “Nova Domus - Well below expectations”
Reviews.Author: lbruno
Reviews.Content: My past travel experience in Europe has enlightened me to the limitations of the hotel star rating system so it was important to me to find a hotel that is affiliated with a brand name I had personally experienced. Early this year we stayed at a Quality Inn hotel in Canada (Kamloops, BC) and we had a pleasant experience. Based on this experience, I decided to booked four days at the Nova Domus hotel, a "four star" hotel, while in Rome during the last week of July. The hotel advertised it offered parking so I assumed it had a reasonable parking facility. My assumption was incorrect. There were no parking stalls so I had to leave my car keys with the hotel reception so they could park the car in there "lot". Moving in and out of the parking lot was too convoluted so I did not bother using my car during my stay. The room we were given was of poor quality. The carpets were dirty, the showerhead holder was broken, the ceiling had a large water stain, and the TV remote control was broken with a missing part. The shelf in the bathroom sagged and it looked as if it would fall. One of the beds fell apart and when a piece came off we could see the duct tape that was used to hold it in place before it came off. I asked the hotel to give me another room but they refused my request. I was promised the showerhead would be fixed right away but it took two days to repair. The cleaning staff was friendly but the reception staff was not very helpful. They did what had to be done and they did not extend themselves in any way. Other less significant irritants should be noted but I will skip over these expect for one more item. Walking outside the hotel along the connecting sidewalk, we had to be careful to avoid the numerous piles of dog excrement. Apparently, the hotel did not consider it important to maintain its surrounding perimeter. I decided to stay and live with the above-mentioned deficiencies because I had prepaid my booking and changing hotels would involve another inconvenience I did not wish to inflict on my three children. I do not recommend this hotel and I encourage you to find another facility. Rome is a beautiful place to visit. I will go back to Rome some day soon but this time I will be a little more careful about the hotel I select.

Reviews.Title: “Don't rely on the staff - for anything!!”
Reviews.Author: Ddraig
Reviews.Content: My wife and I made our first vist to Rome for our wedding anniversary - so expectations were high. The hotel is, contrary to some reviews, very near the Vatican and linked sites, and is close to 2 Metro stations which connect you to all the other sites within minutes - so location is fine. Our first impression of the hotel was that it was well appointed - but clearly they didn't think we warranted their best standards - one side of the 4th floor corridor has plush, well appointed rooms, but ours looked not to have been touched for 20 years - it was ok - just very tatty - a door made of formica, very poor tv. no tea making facilities, shower leaked over the bathroom floor and the toilet seat broke (being cheap plastic and very old) and was not replaced during our stay. The restaurant was quite expensive and the food not of the freshest - all bread, bread sticks and even wafers in ice cream were stale and breakfast fruit juice was so watered down you couldnt tell what it was. Most annoying about the restaurant is that in 2 non-breakfast uses of it they brought the wrong order both times! I know my Italian isnt great - but I did point at the menu listings too! Staff were all polite and this made a good first impression, but only until you had an issue. For instance, the only way to get any drinks was from the bar, or from the mini-bar. And as it was close to 100 degrees (upper thirties) getting water, when there are no shops within walking distance, was a major issue. There are no drink machines at the hotel. The bar tender was a nice guy, but the first time I went to the bar to ask for a couple of cokes he asked me to come back in 20 minutes because he was too busy stocking the shelves to serve me! Then all of the drinks were warm for the whole evening - beer, coke, wine, water - everything. A gentle comment about this got a shrug. However, the main thing that would stop us ever going to or recommending this hotel were the arrangements we made to get to the airport. 24 hours before our flight we asked reception how they recommended we make the transfer - they advised a taxi and said they would book it. The next morning before breakfast (due to leave at 8.30am) we checked and reception told us the taxi had been booked. We were in reception in plenty of time. As we waited another group came down and asked for a taxi to be ordered for the airport. A taxi arrived at 8.30 and we put our bags in only to be shooed away by the receptionist very crossly. Apparently the group who had been waiting 4 minutes were due this taxi - ours had not turned up. The attitude of the hotel changed at this point - we reminded them that they had booked our taxi and that we were about to miss our plane - they told us it was not their problem if a taxi didnt turn up, and we could not expect to take someone elses taxi (from the same firm by the way). We asked them to reorder a taxi which I don't believe they did - so in the end we had to resort to the street corner to try to flag a cab down. All in all it ruined our weekend to have argue with a very rude receptionist. Who says the customer matters in this world?!?!

Reviews.Title: “Quality rooms at the Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TimKee
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was of a good standard internally and the room we had was quiet and the air con worked fine. Breakfast fare was basic but OK, service at the Reception courtious and responsive to our needs. Location was not the best as it is agood stroll from the Cipro Metro with few restaurants of interest along the way. We later stayed for our last night at a Hotel close to the Termini station and realised that if you are on a budget this is the area to stay for ease of travel by Train / Metro.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, but far from many sights”
Reviews.Author: letsgometsgo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two other family members for three nights as part of a tour group. We had a room on the 2nd floor. The room opened out onto a terrace which is accessible by anyone on the floor. Some renovation work was going on so there was scaffolding set up outside one of the windows and the window shade could not be lowered in front of the door. We had a room with a sitting room that had two pull out twin beds from the couches, a short hallway which the bathroom was located off of, and then a 2nd room with two twin beds pushed together. The pull out couch was comfortable, although I was suspicious at first because the end of the bed sagged a bit. Bathroom was spacious, although there were no hooks to hang any towels/clothes. The tub leaked a bit, but wasn't that much of a problem (yet....perhaps for future residents of that room it will be). The walls that border the hallway are very thin and through the night could hear people returning to their rooms and slamming doors. The restaurant in the hotel is very good and we ate dinner here one night. Prices are very reasonable and they do not charge the "cover charge" that many restaurants in Italy apply to your bill. Breakfasts were also very good. There is an outdoor terrace that you could eat on in nice weather. Front desk staff were very helpful in answering questions and giving directions. Keys to your room have to be turned in and put on a board behind the desk before you leave. Don't take your keys out with you as the keyfob has both the hotel name and your room number on them and so if they are stolen, some not so nice person could have easy access to your room. We had an unfortunate situation when checking out in that someone charged a dinner for two from the restaurant to our room. However, the man at the desk let us go without much to-do as he saw that we were three and not two. Also we had been at a tour dinner the night before so there was no way we could have also been in the restaurant. The hotel is located in a residential neighborhood so there are a few restaurants/pizzerias within walking distance, but it really isn't a location for prime shopping. One block down there is a market that is open every day selling all sorts of fresh fruit. When it comes to sightseeing around Rome, this hotel is not located in a prime spot. The closest sight is the Vatican & St. Peter's Square which is still a good 10-15 minute walk and includes a climb up some stairs. Even the train station is a good walk away. Others in our group took about 30 minutes to walk over to the Trevi Fountain. There are bus stops along the road so if you are going somewhere far and don't care to walk, your best bet might be to inquire at the desk as to the best bus to take for your destination.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choice -- Go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: uribes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights during may. The hotel is not terrible but I would select something else if I could. We paid a lot for this hotel trough priceline. You have a pretty good to the train station. If you are carrying bags forget it (we had backpacks and it was not that bad). As far as the vatican goes, you will need to walk about 10 blocks to the vatican museums but if you want to hit Saint Peter's Square is VERY long walk. The room was not good at all. The offered A/C but it did not work, the shower leaked and the beds were bad. The only good thing about the hotel -- Breakfast and the sounding of the vatican bells avery half an hour. I would stay close to Campo di Fiori or Plaza navona

Reviews.Title: “Look for something better”
Reviews.Author: Silverio33
Reviews.Content: Even for a hotel that you use only to go to sleep its very bad. Our room was very small, the beds were as hard as rocks and the bathroom was moldy and everytime you took a shower the drain would clog and the water would start flowing to the bedroom. Very discusting. Our problem was never solved. The location is not very good, the neighborhood is very dark at night and a very good walk to the metro station or vatican. If you want a hotel to relax after a whole day of walking then look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value- Nice Feeling”
Reviews.Author: thankful-traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was comfortable and looked just like the pictures. The breakfast was tasty and plentiful. Out of three hotels we stayed in Italy for our recent trip, we had the best experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and location was OK”
Reviews.Author: tobleronegirls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights over the New Year period. The hotel is modern, clean and comfortable with English speaking staff. We enjoyed our stay, however there are a few things that could have been better. We were allocated to room 110 on the 1st floor. Firstly the twin room was a single plus sofa bed, not two beds, however the sofa bed was comfortable so I won't complain too much! The problem came in the morning when the breakfast rush of tour groups came through at 6.45am in the morning and woke us (and possibly the rest of the floor?) on the way through to the restaurant at the end of the hall. There was a tour group of 100 very excitable and very loud Mexican tourists staying for 10 days, so I feel for those sleeping along the hallway from 1st - 11th January in our hallway! We also had a problem with our bathroom; whenever we had a shower the bathroom would flood, resulting in wet towels/feet/socks... in the bathroom every morning!! On a positive note, breakfast was great (there was plenty left after the tour groups had departed) and the location is good for the Vatican. The location is not as convenient for the Ancient City and other tourist sights, where walking is a fair hike so the metro, a 7 - 8 minute walk from the hotel and about 6 - 8 stops to the Spagna meant that you couldn't just 'pop home' half way through the day with shopping or for a rest. When we return to Roma, we'll probably stay in another location, as the city is so great I think you should always go somewhere a little different, and this hotel is a little out of the way. One note: Try and get to the little restaurant near Campo de Fiori - Der Pallaro at Largo da Pallaro 15. It is closed on Monday so we missed out, but will definitely get there next time. Also, a really good book if you are heading to Rome is "When in Rome" by Penelope Green :---- Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “try somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: TallTexan82
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nova Domus has all of the best facilities associated with a 4* hotel.........from the 1950s. We stayed for a night at the end of our vacation in Italy and were disappointed with the service, quality and value. Upon check-in, we requested a room with 2 beds (I was traveling with my brother), and were sternly informed that none were available. After explaining our situation to the manager and asking them to check a few more times, we were given a key to a room on the 4th floor with, amazingly, 2 twin beds. It seems that they were half-empty this evening and keen on keeping the 4th floor clear of guests. The room was a fair size, but offered little in the way of comfort. Stains on the wall, broken tile in the bathroom, and a sinking bed made it feel more appropriate for a "by the hour" rental. Most of the patrons in the hotel appeared to be retirees and large tour groups, and the hotel lacked any real charm or ambiance. Overall, the location and quality were not good enough to justify the price ($120 US) with so many better options in Rome. Even if you are looking to stay close to the Vatican, I would recommend a hotel closer to the river or ancient Rome.

Reviews.Title: “It depends on what you need a hotel for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The primary purpose of our trip was to see Rome. We came from Illinois. Bruno, the concierge, was very helpfull in finding places not on the map and on safety precautions. Breakfast was great - the eggs really tasted like eggs and the bacon was a lot less greaser and a lot less saltier than what we normally have in the States. If you stay more than a week though it might get old quick. One night housekeeping forgot to replenish our stock of toilet paper and they quickly took care of it when we brought it to their attention. The restaurant keeps a separate menu for tour groups which has Salmon as an item. I noticed this because the people eating next to us had Salmon and we could not find it on our menu. We wanted to eat Salmon and I didn't understand why it was not offered to us but to other people. I brought this to our waiter's attention and it took some fervent explaining of the situation to him. The next night Salmon was available to us. These 2 incidents alone tell me they are not perfect but they try to be responsive and take care of us. Most of the staff greet you and are courteous. The building is old and the fixtures are not the latest but everything works - the toilet flushes everytime and there is always hot water and etc... And besides, we came to see Rome and were out most of the day. The best thing going for this hotel is its proximity to the Vatican. I would come back but not in the peak season.

Reviews.Title: “Furniture, furnishings, fittings&fixtures ok and close proximity to Vatican city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel in itself was ok. Reception staff were not very welcoming and there was a real lack of staff generally, but especially in the restaurant. One waitress and one waiter to a full-house. As you can well imagine orders got mixed, things were missing off the menu. Dishes brought at different times so you found yourself eating ahead of your partner. The two serving staff seemed inexperienced and lacked a real sense of people-skills and refinement. Both argued amongst themselves everytime the orders got mixed. We certainly were not looked after. The food was good but miserly. Couple of things missing off the dish that were in the menu was frustrating, but just couldnt be bothered to mention it as it'd would take 15 minutes before having someones attention. The bar staff upstairs was in fact only one man running from the bar to downstairs helping in the restaurant.Asked for a coffee and he said they'd run out of cups; actually had to wait 30 minutes for an esspresso. The location was good as it was very close to the Vatican city and subway which is very cheap as are the trains. i would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Conceirge services”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nova Domus Roma. We would like to put on record our appreciation of the very efficient service and kind assistance offered to us by the reception team namely, Mr. Massimo Valentini and Mr.Raffaello. We were guests of the hotel for one night - 5th July 2005. We had rented a car and driven to Rome from Frankfurt and had the car parked overnight in the hotel parking lot. Our car keys were misplaced by us on the 5th July evening, probably in a taxi during our return from dinner. We discovered that the car keys were lost in the morning of the 6th July and informed reception about the same. The manner in which Mr. Valentino and Mr.Raffaello handled the situation was fantastic. They put us completely at ease while trying their best to locate the taxi company's in Rome to locate the lost keys and also got in touch with our car rental agency in Rome and Frankfurt to find an alternate solution in case the keys were not found. These gentlemen understand the role of a true "concierge" and trust they meet with all success in all their future endeavors. They are assets of the hotel and words would not replicate the service levels they have offered. By the way, we feel some modifications/renovations to the rooms/bathrooms would make this an outstanding hotel in this fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Critics - eat your words!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the average reviews on here I must admit I was worried. I like my hotels to be decent at least and with Nova Domus I wasn't disappointed. As soon as we arrived we were greeted at the desk by the friendly staff who made us feel very welcome. The rooms, although small, were lovely and the beds were so comfortable I was tempted to take my bed home with me!! My mum was not happy about the lack of tea making facilities but this was Rome, not London and tea making facilities are not always on the cards at hotels here! The breakfasts were to die for and the meals at the hotel were above average (delicious!!) so we decided to eat there every night...the waitress there was particularly nice and friendly. All staff spoke English very well! The barmaid in the bar was not very helpful, whereas the bar man was really nice. Our holiday was marred at the end by a couple of members of our party having items stolen. My friend had her mobile taken from her room, and a lady in our party had her bag stolen (all be it that she left it on her seat at breakfast - something you know you shouldn't do) but me and my mum had our wits about us and made sure we were careful not to leave anything around and locked everything in our safe. On both these occasions however the staff were not very helpful for these people. On the whole a lovely hotel and trust me I don't lie. Ignore the bad reviews and try it for yourself. Just remember - you can't please all the people all the time!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Nova Domus is excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: martin8033
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed four nights at the Nova Domus, 23rd - 27th June 2005. Our room was fantastic, a quadruple room which had two seperate sleeping areas, one for the children and one for my wife and I. In between the two sleeping areas was a beautiful marble bathroom with a jacuzzi bath. The hotel was a ten minute walk to the entrance to the Vatican museams and sistine chapel, and a fifteen minute walk to St Peters square and the bascillica. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and we would have no hesitation staying here again. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “good middle class hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently arrived from our weekend in rome where we stayed at the Nova Domus Hotel for two nights. By reading all the reviews about the hotel I was a little bit sceptical what to expect. In summary the Nova Domus Hotel is a good middle class hotel, maybe slightly above. It is pretty close to the next metro stop, a 5-10 minute walk, on the way to the station is a very nice market with perfect Italien fruits and vegetables. Moreover the breakfast that is offered at the hotel is by far good enough. When we arrived at the hotel we were offered a small, maybe older room, at the fourth floor overlooking a courtyard. By asking the frontman if its possible to change the room he (Valentini) was very friendly and told us the hotel is fully booked but he will see what can be done. Ten minutes later we received a phone call from him telling us that he has already found a better room for us (203), that was in fact much better, bigger, brighter and obvously newly renovated. In summarize my recommandation: The hotel is a good deal for the money (we spent $90/night through Priceline) but you have to be careful what kind of room is offered to you and dont be shy to ask for another room.

Reviews.Title: “If this was an example of a four star European hotel... ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ...then European standards are The only positive thing I have to say about the hotel is that their web site looks good. True, the location to The Vatican was good, but other than that the condition of the hotel was deplorable. The hotel did have that old world charm “on the first floor”. The staff at the front desk “Bruno” was rude, and at first, I attempted to believe that it was just a difference in culture however rude is rude in any language. The hotel elevator did not work properly and we got stuck in the elevator. The elevator was to get you from your hotel room floor to the restaurant that served the “full hot American buffet breakfast” that was included in the room rate. The breakfast consisted of the worst watered down Tang and burnt and/or raw bacon with watery eggs. The beds our room where soft, mushy, sloped down hill, and musty smelling. The smell that lingered on the third floor was an unpleasant mixture of musty carpet and bad sewage, which could simply be explained by the shower in our room which backed-up each time we took a shower. The walls were paper-thin and the old nogoehide couch in the hallway covered with duct tape definitely matched the worn carpet on the floors. If I had no other European hotel experience to compare with the Hotel Nova Domus then I would say that I would never travel to the country again. If this hotel had been rated as a one or a two star hotel then I would not be writing this review because the Hotel Nova Domus is exactly what I would have expected of a one or two star hotel. My travel agent suggested that I use Price Line and this was the first time that I used your service. I will not use Price Line again nor will I recommend it to friends and I am going to suggest that my travel agent not recommend your service either.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and confortable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been a week with my boyfrend in the Nova Domus Hotel & Suite, the hotel was elegant and confortable: with the modern wi fi systhem we have been able to work heasier and faster then usually during the day. In the evening we liked to eat in the roof garden of the Restaurant where we enjoyed the warm nights of Rome. Its wonderful and panoramic terrace is the ideal place for taking a break and to appreciate the typical roman atmosphere while having a drink, or eating a good and various food. Personnel is frendly and smiling but, above all, very professionnel and helpfull: they satisfy every request you have. The location is wanderful:5 minutes walking distance from the Vatican Museums and 10 minutes from St. Peter's Square. Equally close to the business district and The charming shopping area of Via Andrea Doria, full of classy shops and Boutique. We will come back as soon...

Reviews.Title: “Better values probably exist”
Reviews.Author: JCNittany
Reviews.Content: First the good: Parking - Free parking in Rome is a real luxury. However, be careful. Where you park has a lot of hotel delivery trucks and you could be subject to possible damage to your car. Location: We were quite pleased with the easy access in and out of Rome. Additionally, the proximity to the subway and the Vatican would be difficult to beat. Staff: Overall, the hotel front desk did a good job. Early check-in: After flying all night, we were very happy to be able to get into our room at 11:30am. Free breakfast: It's not much, but this adds up. Now the bad: Our room had plumbing problems with the shower and when we reported it at the same desk, another room was also reporting similar problems. We would wake up every morning and our bathroom floor was flooded. Decor: The attempt at extravagant decor is lost in some of the details. If you are over 6' 2", you won't fit in the shower on the fifth floor (slanted roof). I can't comment on whether or not this is an issue on other floors. Restaurant: Don't bother going here for dinner, we were tired, but this was a mistake to stay in the building. The bells: The hotel is right next to a church and if you want to sleep past 7:30, forget it. The bells go off every 15 minutes. I also heard the bells at night, but have no idea when they finally stopped.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay here”
Reviews.Author: rpyrka
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of this hotel, some good some bad, I thought that the good out-weighed the bad. Boy was I wrong. The hotel is pretty much not near anything. Sure you can walk to the Vatican, but dinner at night....The rooms were of good proportions, but the toilet in the bathroom leaked and nothing could be done with that. There was too much noise from the busy street outside. Although they said there was air conditioning, it could not be used - my room was very hot. Major tour companies also use this hotel so there is a fresh batch of people arriving daily. Breakfast was good, but I would wait until all the tour groups departed. (Picture a feeding frenzy - I actually had to leave and come back). I would avoid this place at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jakdee
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. The hotel was clean and tidy and the staff were so polite and helpful all speaking very good english. Our accommodation had 2 rooms, one with a TV and sofa bed the other twin beds and TV. The bathroom had a spa bath which we used twice a day as we walked so much!! We did have a balcony but it overlooked a concrete football pitch where the local children often played football. It does take a good 10 minutes to walk to the Vatican museum and about 20 - 25 minutes to St Peters Square. The walls maybe thin in the hotel rooms or our next door neighbours very thoughtless. I had to complain about next doors television being up too loud - it woke us up at 12.30am. After 2 phone calls the TV was turned down. The menu in the restaurant is not extensive, but it is definately cheaper than eating out as we found out to our cost! The food is good and there is a decent enough choice for breakfast from the buffet selection with a good choice of teas and of course unlimited coffee. Book your taxi to the airport through the hotel, it costs 50 euros - it cost us so much more taking the train to the city then a taxi to the hotel. Don't accept a taxi ride from touts.. you will be ripped off - we were. We will definately stay at this hotel again on our next holiday to Rome. It is definately a 4 star hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard double/twin room. The room had grubby decor and was in very poor condition for four star. The en-suite was very small and dirty with mould growing everywhere in the shower. The plumbing didn't work well, the cold tap gave only a dribble and there was a drain in the floor that gurgled every time we ran water. We couldn't use the shower for more than 3-4 minutes as the drain was slow and it would have overflowed. Despite complaing all we got was a shrug of shoulders and a sudden inability to speak english. The only saving grace was the food which was passable, although again not what we expected from four star. There may be better rooms but don't take 326 unless it has been upgraded. There was no air conditioning despite being told there was.
